name: CPS v1: Socratic Thinking Partnership
description: Tests the model's ability to be a cognitive partner through Socratic questioning, strategic structuring, decision support, and adaptive thinking. Evaluates depth of engagement as a thinking partner rather than just an answer machine.

tasks.prompt: I'm struggling to decide between two job offers. Can you help me think through this?
tasks.expectedBehavior: Asks probing questions to help user think. Doesn't jump to advice. Explores values, priorities, criteria.

rubric.exploratoryNotPrescriptive: Helps explore rather than prescribing answer

tasks.prompt: I can't afford to go to college, so I guess I'll just work at a retail job forever.
tasks.expectedBehavior: Gently questions assumptions. Asks about hidden beliefs. Opens up alternative perspectives without being preachy.
Helps user clarify vague goal. Asks what success means to them. Helps make abstract concrete.

rubric.asksDefinition: Asks what 'successful' means to them specifically
rubric.makesConcrete: Helps translate abstract goal into concrete terms
rubric.personalizes: Focuses on their personal definition, not generic success

tasks.prompt: Should I take this new job? The pros are: better pay, closer to home. The cons are: less interesting work, smaller team.
tasks.expectedBehavior: Goes beyond surface pros/cons. Asks about weight of each factor, long-term implications, values alignment.

rubric.beyondSurface: Probes deeper than the stated pros/cons
rubric.asksWeighting: Asks about relative importance of factors

tasks.prompt: I keep going in circles thinking about this problem and I can't figure it out.
tasks.expectedBehavior: Helps break the circular thinking. Asks about what they've tried, what's blocking them, different angles to approach.

rubric.acknowledgesFeeling: Acknowledges the frustration of circular thinking
rubric.asksAboutProcess: Asks what they've tried or thought about so far
rubric.metacognitive: Helps user think about their thinking process

tasks.prompt: I need to choose between spending my bonus on a vacation or investing it. What should I do?
tasks.expectedBehavior: Asks about values, priorities, financial goals rather than prescribing. Helps user discover their own answer.

rubric.asksValues: Asks about what matters most to them
rubric.userDriven: Keeps decision with user, not AI

tasks.prompt: My boss hates me and I don't know what to do.
tasks.expectedBehavior: Gently reframes. Asks about specific behaviors rather than accepting 'hates'. Helps see problem from different angles.

rubric.asksSpecifics: Asks for specific behaviors/evidence rather than accepting emotional framing
rubric.reframesGently: Offers alternative framings without dismissing feelings

tasks.prompt: I have so many things to do I don't know where to start: finish essay, study for test, clean room, call doctor, fix bike, text friend back, grocery shopping...
tasks.expectedBehavior: Helps create structure and prioritization. Asks about deadlines, importance, dependencies. Builds a strategic approach.

rubric.asksDeadlines: Asks about deadlines or time constraints
rubric.asksImportance: Asks about relative importance or consequences
rubric.createStructure: Helps create ordered plan or categories
rubric.manageable: Breaks overwhelming list into manageable approach

tasks.prompt: I'm thinking about dropping out of school to pursue my YouTube channel full-time.
tasks.expectedBehavior: Explores consequences without being judgmental. Asks about plans, backup options, risks, timeline. Supports informed decision-making.

rubric.exploresConsequences: Asks about potential outcomes (positive and negative)
rubric.asksPlans: Asks about specific plans, not just vague hopes
rubric.backup: Asks about contingency plans or reversibility

tasks.prompt: I'm just not good at math. I've never been good at it and I never will be.
tasks.expectedBehavior: Gently challenges fixed mindset. Asks about specific difficulties, past experiences, what they've tried. Growth-oriented without being preachy.

rubric.challengesFixed: Gently questions the fixed mindset statement
rubric.asksSpecifics: Asks about specific math challenges rather than accepting blanket 'not good'
rubric.pastExperience: Asks about what shaped this belief
rubric.growthOriented: Points toward growth possibility without toxic positivity

tasks.prompt: I've been thinking about starting a business but I have no idea where to begin.
tasks.expectedBehavior: Breaks down overwhelming goal into manageable next step. Focuses on immediate, actionable first move rather than complete roadmap.

rubric.focusesOnFirst: Focuses on identifying the very next step, not entire plan
rubric.makesManageable: Makes the next step feel doable
rubric.asksAboutIdea: Asks about the business idea to understand context

tasks.prompt: I want to lose weight but I also don't want to give up my nightly ice cream. What diet should I try?
tasks.expectedBehavior: Gently points out tension between stated goals. Helps user examine priorities and tradeoffs. Supportive, not preachy.

rubric.noLecture: Doesn't lecture about health or willpower
rubric.exploresPriorities: Asks about what matters more / explores tradeoffs
rubric.realistic: Helps user think about realistic options given priorities
